readable: 0. It's very fixed information for a changing climate, and the farmer knows this, but he can't transfer that knowledge to SAED because he doesn't actually know if it's important that is, you can't tell if something weird is consequential until you see if the harvest is bad or not.
stripped: fix information change climate farmer know transfer knowledge sae actually know important tell something weird consequential see harvest bad

readable: 1. Buyers will ask if a farmer has access to a harvester, to ensure they can get help harvesting their land.
stripped: buyer ask farmer access harvester ensure get help harvest land

readable: 2. If a farmer waits until the rice is ready, he might lose more than if he harvests early.
stripped: farmer wait rice ready might lose harvest early

readable: 3. Dr. Fall expects him to harvest early.
stripped: dr fall expect harvest early

readable: 4. If labor is available, and the harvesters are not available, a farmer will harvest early if he expects a good market price or if birds are nearby or if he wants to spend less on harvest.
stripped: labor available harvester available farmer harvest early expect good market price bird nearby want spend less harvest

readable: 5. If a farmer's farm size is big enough, he will wait until harvesters are available, but if his plots are small, he will hire labor.
stripped: farmer farm size big enough wait harvester available plot small hire labor

readable: 6. If a farmer harvests paddy rice late, he won't be able to start tomatoes in the colddry season.
stripped: farmer harvest paddy rice late able start tomato cold dry season

readable: 7. Suppose that Mr. A has harvested, but he hasn't repaid his coop yet.
stripped: suppose mr harvest repay cooperative yet

readable: 8. Sometimes farmers just do one crop a year because they harvest late, etc.
stripped: sometimes farmer one crop year harvest late

readable: 9. The government is relying on farmers to be able to reduce the amount of imported food, and is making equipment and technology available to try and increase production.
stripped: government rely farmer able reduce amount import food make equipment technology available try increase production

readable: 10. The local cooperative wouldn't help an elderly couple without children to harvest their fields, because cooperatives have their own goals.
stripped: local cooperative help elderly couple without child harvest field cooperative goal

readable: 11. It is culturally expected to help elders and to go harvest their fields and give them the product.
stripped: culturally expect help elder go harvest field give product

readable: 12. At harvest time, the cooperative has to collect ALL the yield from farmers and store in headquarters; then they take all the corresponding credit from each farmer's production and leave the remaining to each farmer.
stripped: harvest time cooperative collect yield farmer store headquarters take corresponding credit farmer production leave remain farmer

readable: 13. Financing line in any bank they choose, to support startup costs and subsidize through credit for farmers, e.g. for new equipment, etc.
stripped: financing line bank choose support startup cost subsidize credit farmer new equipment

readable: 14. For improving the system itself, farmers need to be pushed to get access to equipment.
stripped: improve system farmer need push get access equipment

readable: 15. Credit union makes a program to subsidize 20 or 30% of equipment cost, so farmers pay back only 70% of 40 million or whatever.
stripped: credit union make program subsidize equipment cost farmer pay back million whatever

readable: 16. Labor most of the irrigated system requires a lot of labor if you're not using machinery (and you probably aren't because it's expensive.)
stripped: labor irrigate system require lot labor use machinery probably expensive

readable: 17. You might not have enough money to hire labor, COVID might make it difficult, or nobody can move the machinery to where you are.
stripped: might enough money hire labor covid might make difficult nobody move machinery

readable: 18. But for onions, the farmers being in cooperatives, they lobby to pressure the government for a grace period after harvest where imports are stopped, e.g. a month in which domestic producers can sell before imports are allowed.
stripped: onion farmer cooperative lobby pressure government grace period harvest import stop month domestic producer sell import allow

readable: 19.  Diagram time During harvest, there's a few factors to consider.
stripped:
diagram time 

 harvest factor consider

readable: 20. For the majority, you have to ask if you have equipment ready to harvest.
stripped: majority ask equipment ready harvest

readable: 21. Are you willing to harvest very rapidly because you're having bird attacks or other damages that speed up your timeline; is it wet or dry, because the humidity of the paddy means some might be lost by machinery; and labor is cheaper than equipment.
stripped: willing harvest rapidly bird attack damage speed timeline wet dry humidity paddy mean might lose machinery labor cheap equipment

readable: 22. A final factor is that you need to repay your loans before you can get new credit, so you want to harvest faster so you can repay faster.
stripped: final factor need repay loan get new credit want harvest fast repay fast

readable: 23. For labor, you pay 110th of your production for a harvester.
stripped: labor pay th production harvester

readable: 24. If you use a thresher on top of that, that costs 18%.
stripped: use harvester top cost

readable: 25. If you use a thresher with tiny plots, sometimes you lose more yield than if you were using labor.
stripped: use harvester tiny plot sometimes lose yield use labor

readable: 26. But others say threshers produce clean, fast, high quality paddy without a bunch of weeds, and labor takes time
stripped: other say harvester produce clean fast high quality paddy without bunch weed labor take time

readable: 27. Dr. Fall believes that if you have a small plot, it's best to use manual labor if you harvest on time.
stripped: dr fall believe small plot good use manual labor harvest time

readable: 28. If you have a big plot, there's no way you can harvest it all on time by labor!
stripped: big plot way harvest time labor

readable: 29. Unfortunately, everybody wants to harvest at the last moment, and then there's no service providers available.
stripped: unfortunately everybody want harvest last moment service provider available

readable: 30. Another factor is that labor gets more expensive when there's crops being harvested for export markets that compete.
stripped: another factor labor get expensive crop harvest export market compete

readable: 31. But for seeding and harvesting, it mostly comes from hired labor.
stripped: seeding harvesting mostly come hire labor

readable: 32. There's seeding periods, harvest periods, where labor is needed in various industries and there's a competition.
stripped: seeding period harvest period labor need various industry competition

readable: 33. But during harvest time for rice, harvest for rice corresponds to seeding period for horticulture croppings.
stripped: harvest time rice harvest rice correspond seed period horticulture cropping

readable: 34. So if those farms need labor for horticulture, they may compete with farms that need harvest labor.
stripped: farm need labor horticulture may compete farm need harvest labor

readable: 35. They'll hire temporary labor for periods like seeding and harvesting, but there's still room for small farmers.
stripped: hire temporary labor period like seeding harvesting still room small farmer

readable: 36. Farmers really need hired labor for harvesting; for the seeding period, they may be able to rely on family labor.
stripped: farmer really need hire labor harvesting seeding period may able rely family labor

readable: 37. If you have machinery, you just need two people: One to drive, one to guide, no matter the number of hectares.
stripped: machinery need two people one drive one guide matter number hectare

readable: 38. But if you go for manual labor, it might take three people three days (8hr a day) to harvest one hectare.
stripped: go manual labor might take three people three day hr day harvest one hectare

readable: 39. Service providers need to check before they agree to harvest.
stripped: service provider need check agree harvest

readable: 40. In his opinion, 85% are always using machinery.

readable: 41. It's because they harvest late and they don't have time to go for labor.

readable: 42. Some of them buy batteuse-ASI (mini-thresher).

readable: 43. We could see horticulture harvests around January and early February (we would see a lot of farms doing onions and tomatoes).

readable: 44. Harvest delays due to restricted access to labor and equipment.
stripped: harvest delay due restricted access labor equipment

readable: 45. Since people harvest in June or late July, it takes roughly 3 months to collect debts.

readable: 46. The bulletin says the remaining credit comes from credit loaned on onions, which is supposed to be paid by June six months between onion harvest and full credit reimbursement!
stripped: bulletin say remain credit come credit loan onion suppose pay june six month onion harvest full credit reimbursement

readable: 47. Not able to predict the level of production in the future due to uncertain factors, e.g. do farmers have access to inputs, does the credit come in on time, do farmers use technology and machinery or not all of these factors constrain the area cultivated.
stripped: able predict level production future due uncertain factor farmer access input credit come time farmer use technology machinery factor constrain area cultivate

readable: 48. Another issue is the access to mechanization services, e.g. for harvest; service providers are not always ready on time to provide the services farmers need.
stripped: another issue access mechanization service harvest service provider always ready time provide service farmer need

readable: 49. There aren't enough service providers with enough equipment; some equipment sometimes isn't adapted to the land (e.g. the big harvesters won't be able to handle small parcels).
stripped: enough service provider enough equipment equipment sometimes adapt land big harvester able handle small parcel

readable: 50.  Diagram time Dr. Fall says there can be positive or negative effects of climate change on harvest time.

diagram time 
 dr fall say positive negative effect climate change harvest time

readable: 51. You have to make sure to harvest on time, clean up the plot, that you have the money to get the inputs you need on time (you have your own money or you go to another lender), etc.
stripped: make sure harvest time clean plot money get input need time money go another lender

readable: 52. The availability of equipment for land prep is another factor.
stripped: availability equipment land prep another factor

readable: 53. Plant short duration seeds in dry season because there's a short window for harvest.
stripped: plant short duration seed dry season short window harvest

readable: 54. The timing of harvest is linked to CC because the start of the rainy season is coming earlier and earlier each year, they have to harvest before it arrives or the soil will be wet and the harvesters won't be able to pass over the soil.
stripped: timing harvest link cc start rainy season come early early year harvest arrive soil wet harvester able pass soil

readable: 55. They harvest early to protect themselves from the consequences of CC.

readable: 56. But it is better to harvest early because you don't want the birds to come at the end of the season and eat your harvest.
stripped: well harvest early want bird come end season eat harvest

readable: 57. SAED doesn't provide information about whether they should harvest early or not they just make the judgment themselves.
stripped: sae provide information whether harvest early make judgment

readable: 58. Farmers that harvest earlier tend to have better yields: 2 - 3 tons earlier.
stripped: farmer harvest early tend well yield ton early

readable: 59. There's a window for harvest in rice and if you harvest later, the yields decrease.
stripped: window harvest rice harvest later yield decrease

readable: 60. If you sow earlier and harvest at the ideal time, you also are more likely to get access to harvesting equipment.
stripped: sow early harvest ideal time likely get access harvesting equipment

readable: 61. Even if they sow early, they might not have access to a harvester, so they might be waiting for a month to get access.

readable: 64. Farmers that plant early and harvest early in one season can double crop.
